title: [SortedEffects: Sorted Causal Effects in R](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1909.00836.pdf)
coauthors: with Victor Chernozhukov, Ivan Fernandez-Val and Ye Luo
abstract: **Abstract:** [Chernozhukov, Fernandez-Val and Luo (2018)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.3982/ECTA14415) proposed the sorted effect method for nonlinear regression models. This method consists of reporting percentiles of the partial effects in addition to the average commonly used to summarize the heterogeneity in the partial effects. They also proposed to use the sorted effects to carry out classification analysis where the observational units are classified as most and least affected if their causal effects are above or below some tail sorted effects. The R package SortedEffects implements the estimation and inference methods therein and provides tools to visualize the results. This vignette serves as an introduction to the package and displays basic functionality of the functions within.

title: [Mastering Panel Metrics: Causal Impact of Democracy on Growth](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1901.03821.pdf)
coauthors: with Victor Chernozhukov and Ivan Fernandez-Val
abstract: **Abstract:** Split sample bias correction for many instruments and many fixed effects problems
